00010 void SISO::descrambler(itpp::vec &extrinsic_coded, itpp::vec &extrinsic_data, const itpp::vec &intrinsic_coded, const itpp::vec &apriori_data)
00011 /*
00012   inputs:
00013   intrinsic_coded - intrinsic information of coded bits (repetition code output)
00014   apriori_data - a priori information of informational bits (repetition code input)
00015   outputs:
00016   extrinsic_coded - extrinsic information of coded bits
00017   extrinsic_data - Logarithm of Likelihood Ratio of informational bits
00018 */
00019 {
00020     //get parameters
00021     int nb_bits = apriori_data.length();
00022     int Nc = scrambler_pattern.length();
00023     //implementation
00024     extrinsic_data.set_size(nb_bits);
00025     extrinsic_coded.set_size(nb_bits*Nc);
00026     register int n,k;
00027 #pragma omp parallel for private(n,k)
00028     for (k=0;k<nb_bits;k++)
00029     {
00030         extrinsic_data[k] = 0;//apriori_data[k];//add a priori info
00031         for (n=0;n<Nc;n++)
00032         {
00033             extrinsic_data[k] += (1-2*double(scrambler_pattern[n]))*intrinsic_coded[n+k*Nc];
00034         }
00035         for (n=0;n<Nc;n++)
00036         {
00037             extrinsic_coded[n+k*Nc] = (1-2*double(scrambler_pattern[n]))*extrinsic_data[k]-intrinsic_coded[n+k*Nc];
00038         }
00039     }
00040 }
00041 
00042 void SISO::zpFIRfilter(itpp::vec &filt, const itpp::vec &h, const itpp::vec &sig)
00043 //FIR filter for a zero padded signal (L zeros are added at the end of the signal)
00044 {
00045     //get parameters
00046     int L = h.length()-1;
00047     int N = sig.length();
00048     //implementation
00049     register int n,l;
00050 #pragma omp parallel for private(n,l)
00051     for (n=0;n<(N+L);n++)
00052     {
00053         filt[n] = 0;
00054         for (l=0;l<=L;l++)
00055         {
00056             if ((n-l)<0)
00057             {
00058                 break;//channel has state 0 at the beginning
00059             }
00060             if ((n-l)>=N)
00061             {
00062                 continue;//channel has state 0 in the end
00063             }
00064             filt[n] += (h[l]*sig[n-l]);
00065         }
00066     }
00067 }
00068 
00069 void SISO::gen_hyperTrellis(void)
00070 /* generates channel hyper trellis for binary symbols
00071  * the channel is a MISO system
00072  * BPSK mapping: 0->+1, 1->-1
00073  */
00074 {
00075     //get parameters
00076     int nb_usr = impulse_response.rows();
00077     int ch_order = impulse_response.cols()-1;
00078     int p_order = prec_gen.length()-1;
00079     int max_order = std::max(ch_order, p_order);
00080 
00081     //initialize hypertrellis
00082     chtrellis.numInputSymbols = itpp::pow2i(nb_usr);
00083     int mem_len = nb_usr*max_order;
00084     if (mem_len>=(int)(8*sizeof(int)))
00085     {
00086         std::string msg = "SISO::gen_hyperTrellis: memory length of the hyperchannel should be at most ";
00087         msg += itpp::to_str(8*sizeof(int)-1);
00088         msg += ". Try to lower the number of users, channel order or the order of the precoding polynomial (if any)";
00089         print_err_msg(msg);
00090         return;
00091     }
00092     chtrellis.stateNb = itpp::pow2i(mem_len);
00093     try
00094     {
00095         long long int len =  static_cast<long long int>(chtrellis.stateNb)*static_cast<long long int>(chtrellis.numInputSymbols);
00096         chtrellis.nextState = new int[len];
00097         chtrellis.prevState = new int[len];
00098         chtrellis.output = new double[len];
00099         chtrellis.input = new int[len];
00100     } catch (std::bad_alloc)
00101     {
00102         std::string msg = "SISO::gen_hyperTrellis: not enough memory for the channel trellis variables. The number of states is ";
00103         msg += itpp::to_str(chtrellis.stateNb);
00104         msg += " and the number of input symbols ";
00105         msg += itpp::to_str(chtrellis.numInputSymbols);
00106         print_err_msg(msg);
00107         return;
00108     }
00109     itpp::ivec index(chtrellis.stateNb);
00110     index.zeros();
00111     itpp::bvec hyper_ch_mem(mem_len);
00112     itpp::bvec hyper_ch_in(nb_usr);
00113     itpp::bvec hyper_states(mem_len);
00114     itpp::bin feedback;
00115 
00116     //create hypertrellis
00117     register int n,k,p,r;
00118     int buffer;
00119     double hyper_ch_out;
00120     for(k=0;k<chtrellis.stateNb;k++)
00121     {
00122         hyper_ch_mem = itpp::dec2bin(mem_len, k);//initial state
00123         for(n=0;n<chtrellis.numInputSymbols;n++)
00124         {
00125             hyper_ch_in = itpp::dec2bin(nb_usr, n);//MISO channel input
00126             hyper_ch_out = 0;
00127             for(r=0;r<nb_usr;r++)
00128             {
00129                 buffer = r*max_order;
00130                 //precoder
00131                 feedback = hyper_ch_in[r];
00132                 for (p=1;p<=p_order;p++)
00133                 {
00134                     if (prec_gen(p))
00135                     {
00136                         feedback ^= hyper_ch_mem[p-1+buffer];//xor
00137                     }
00138                 }
00139                 //FIR channel output
00140                 hyper_ch_out += (1-2*double(feedback))*impulse_response(r,0);
00141                 for(p=0;p<ch_order;p++)
00142                 {
00143                     hyper_ch_out += (1-2*double(hyper_ch_mem[p+buffer]))*impulse_response(r,p+1);//hyper channel output for user r
00144                 }
00145                 //(equivalent) channel next state
00146                 hyper_states[buffer] = feedback;
00147                 for(p=0;p<(max_order-1);p++)
00148                 {
00149                     hyper_states[p+buffer+1] = hyper_ch_mem[p+buffer];//next hyper state for user r
00150                 }
00151             }
00152             chtrellis.output[k+n*chtrellis.stateNb] = hyper_ch_out;
00153             buffer = itpp::bin2dec(hyper_states);//next state from an initial state and a given input
00154             chtrellis.nextState[k+n*chtrellis.stateNb] = buffer;
00155             chtrellis.prevState[buffer+index[buffer]*chtrellis.stateNb] = k;
00156             chtrellis.input[buffer+index[buffer]*chtrellis.stateNb] = n;
00157             index[buffer]++;
00158         }
00159     }
00160 }

00166 void SISO::mud_maxlogMAP(itpp::mat &extrinsic_data, const itpp::vec &rec_sig, const itpp::mat &apriori_data)
00167 /* output:
00168  * extrinsic_data - extrinsic information for the chips (usr_nb x block_len)
00169  * inputs:
00170  * rec_sig - received signal (1 x block_len)
00171  * apriori_data - a priori information for the chips (usr_nb x block_len)
00172  */
00173 {
00174     //get parameters
00175     int nb_usr = apriori_data.rows();
00176     int block_len = apriori_data.cols();
00177 
00178     //init trellis
00179     gen_hyperTrellis();
00180 
00181     //initial conditions for A = log(alpha) and B = log(beta)
00182     double *A = NULL,*B = NULL;
00183     try
00184     {
00185         A = new double[chtrellis.stateNb*(block_len+1)];
00186         B = new double[chtrellis.stateNb*(block_len+1)];
00187     } catch (std::bad_alloc)
00188     {
00189         std::string msg = "SISO::mud_maxlogMAP: Not enough memory for alphas and betas. The number of states is ";
00190         msg += itpp::to_str(chtrellis.stateNb);
00191         msg += " and the block length ";
00192         msg += itpp::to_str(block_len);
00193         print_err_msg(msg);
00194     }
00195     register int n;
00196     A[0] = 0;
00197     B[block_len*chtrellis.stateNb] = 0;
00198     double buffer = (tail?-INFINITY:0);
00199 #pragma omp parallel for private(n)
00200     for (n=1;n<chtrellis.stateNb;n++)
00201     {
00202         A[n] = -INFINITY;
00203         B[n+block_len*chtrellis.stateNb] = buffer;//if tail==false the final state is not known
00204     }
00205 
00206     //compute log(alpha) (forward recursion)
00207     register int s,k;
00208     int sp,i;
00209     itpp::bvec in_chips(nb_usr);
00210 #pragma omp parallel sections private(n,buffer,s,k,sp,in_chips)
00211 {
00212     for(n=1;n<=block_len;n++)
00213     {
00214         buffer = -INFINITY;//normalization factor
00215         for(s=0;s<chtrellis.stateNb;s++)
00216         {
00217             A[s+n*chtrellis.stateNb] = -INFINITY;
00218             for(k=0;k<chtrellis.numInputSymbols;k++)
00219             {
00220                 sp = chtrellis.prevState[s+k*chtrellis.stateNb];
00221                 i = chtrellis.input[s+k*chtrellis.stateNb];
00222                 in_chips = itpp::dec2bin(nb_usr, i);
00223                 A[s+n*chtrellis.stateNb] = std::max(A[s+n*chtrellis.stateNb], \
00224                                             A[sp+(n-1)*chtrellis.stateNb]-itpp::sqr(rec_sig[n-1]-chtrellis.output[sp+i*chtrellis.stateNb])/(2*sigma2)+\
00225                                             itpp::to_vec(in_chips)*apriori_data.get_col(n-1));
00226             }
00227             buffer = std::max(buffer, A[s+n*chtrellis.stateNb]);
00228         }
00229         //normalization
00230         for(s=0;s<chtrellis.stateNb;s++)
00231         {
00232             A[s+n*chtrellis.stateNb] -= buffer;
00233         }
00234     }
00235 
00236     //compute log(beta) (backward recursion)
00237 #pragma omp section
00238     for(n=block_len-1;n>=0;n--)
00239     {
00240         buffer = -INFINITY;//normalization factor
00241         for(s=0;s<chtrellis.stateNb;s++)
00242         {
00243             B[s+n*chtrellis.stateNb] = -INFINITY;
00244             for(k=0;k<chtrellis.numInputSymbols;k++)
00245             {
00246                 sp = chtrellis.nextState[s+k*chtrellis.stateNb];
00247                 in_chips = itpp::dec2bin(nb_usr, k);
00248                 B[s+n*chtrellis.stateNb] = std::max(B[s+n*chtrellis.stateNb], \
00249                                                 B[sp+(n+1)*chtrellis.stateNb]-itpp::sqr(rec_sig[n]-chtrellis.output[s+k*chtrellis.stateNb])/(2*sigma2)+\
00250                                                 itpp::to_vec(in_chips)*apriori_data.get_col(n));
00251             }
00252             buffer = std::max(buffer, B[s+n*chtrellis.stateNb]);
00253         }
00254         //normalization
00255         for(s=0;s<chtrellis.stateNb;s++)
00256         {
00257             B[s+n*chtrellis.stateNb] -= buffer;
00258         }
00259     }
00260 }
00261 
00262     //compute extrinsic information
00263     double nom, denom;
00264     extrinsic_data.set_size(nb_usr,block_len);
00265     register int u;
00266 #pragma omp parallel for private(u,n,s,k,nom,denom,in_chips,buffer)
00267     for(u=0;u<nb_usr;u++)
00268     {
00269         for(n=1;n<=block_len;n++)
00270         {
00271             nom = -INFINITY;
00272             denom = -INFINITY;
00273             for(s=0;s<chtrellis.stateNb;s++)
00274             {
00275                 for(k=0;k<chtrellis.numInputSymbols;k++)
00276                 {
00277                     in_chips = itpp::dec2bin(nb_usr, k);
00278                     buffer = A[s+(n-1)*chtrellis.stateNb]+B[chtrellis.nextState[s+k*chtrellis.stateNb]+n*chtrellis.stateNb]-\
00279                              itpp::sqr(rec_sig[n-1]-chtrellis.output[s+k*chtrellis.stateNb])/(2*sigma2)+\
00280                              itpp::to_vec(in_chips)*apriori_data.get_col(n-1);
00281                     if(in_chips[u])
00282                     {
00283                         nom = std::max(nom, buffer);
00284                     }
00285                     else
00286                     {
00287                         denom = std::max(denom, buffer);
00288                     }
00289                 }
00290             }
00291             extrinsic_data(u,n-1) = (nom-denom)-apriori_data(u,n-1);
00292         }
00293     }
00294     //free memory
00295     delete[] chtrellis.nextState;
00296     delete[] chtrellis.prevState;
00297     delete[] chtrellis.output;
00298     delete[] chtrellis.input;
00299     delete[] A;
00300     delete[] B;
00301 }

00304 
00306 void SISO::GCD(itpp::mat &extrinsic_data, const itpp::vec &rec_sig, const itpp::mat &apriori_data)
00307 /* Gaussian Chip Detector
00308  * output:
00309  * extrinsic_data - extrinsic information of emitted chips
00310  * inputs:
00311  * rec_sig - received signal
00312  * apriori_data - a priori information of emitted chips
00313  */
00314 {
00315     //get parameters
00316     int N = apriori_data.cols();//emitted frames of non-zero samples
00317     int K = apriori_data.rows();//number of users
00318     int L = impulse_response.cols()-1;//channel order
00319     //other parameters
00320     register int n,k;
00321 
00322     //mean and variance of each chip (NxK)
00323     itpp::mat Ex = -itpp::tanh(apriori_data/2.0);//take into account BPSK mapping
00324     itpp::mat Vx = 1.0-sqr(Ex);
00325 
00326     //expectation and variance of the received signal
00327     itpp::vec Er(N+L);
00328     Er.zeros();
00329     itpp::mat Covr;
00330     try
00331     {
00332         Covr.set_size(N+L,N+L);
00333     } catch (std::bad_alloc)
00334     {
00335         std::string msg = "SISO::GCD: not enough memory when allocating space for the covariance matrix. The interleaver length is ";
00336         msg += itpp::to_str(N);
00337         msg += ". Use sGCD instead or try to reduce the interleaver length";
00338         print_err_msg(msg);
00339         return;
00340     }
00341     //create eye function
00342     Covr.zeros();
00343     for (n=0;n<(N+L);n++)
00344         Covr(n,n) = 1;
00345     itpp::vec col(N+L);
00346     col.zeros();
00347     itpp::vec row(N);
00348     row.zeros();
00349     itpp::mat h_eq(N+L,N);
00350     for (k=0;k<K;k++)
00351     {
00352         col.replace_mid(0, impulse_response.get_row(k));
00353         row(0) = impulse_response(k,0);
00354         h_eq = itpp::toeplitz(col, row);
00355         Er += h_eq*Ex.get_row(k);
00356         Covr += (h_eq*itpp::diag(Vx.get_row(k)))*h_eq.T();
00357     }
00358 
00359     //extrinsic information
00360     double nom,denom;
00361     Er = rec_sig-Er;
00362     itpp::mat inv_Covr(N+L,N+L);
00363     inv_Covr = itpp::inv(Covr);
00364     itpp::mat inv_cov_zeta(N+L,N+L);
00365     itpp::vec rec_chip(N+L);
00366     extrinsic_data.set_size(K,N);
00367     for (k=0;k<K;k++)
00368     {
00369 #pragma omp parallel for private(n,inv_cov_zeta,rec_chip,nom,denom) firstprivate(col)
00370         for (n=0;n<N;n++)
00371         {
00372             col.replace_mid(n, impulse_response.get_row(k));
00373             inv_cov_zeta = inv_Covr+itpp::outer_product(inv_Covr*col, inv_Covr.T()*(col*Vx(k,0)))/(1-(col*Vx(k,0))*(inv_Covr*col));
00374             rec_chip = Er-col*(+1-Ex(k,n));
00375             nom = -0.5*rec_chip*(inv_cov_zeta*rec_chip);
00376             rec_chip = Er-col*(-1-Ex(k,n));
00377             denom = -0.5*rec_chip*(inv_cov_zeta*rec_chip);
00378             extrinsic_data(k,n) = denom-nom;//take into account BPSK mapping
00379             col(n) = 0;
00380         }
00381     }
00382 }

00385 
00388 void SISO::sGCD(itpp::mat &extrinsic_data, const itpp::vec &rec_sig, const itpp::mat &apriori_data)
00389 /* simplified GCD
00390  * output:
00391  * extrinsic_data - extrinsic information of emitted chips
00392  * inputs:
00393  * rec_sig - received signal
00394  * apriori_data - a priori information of emitted chips
00395  */
00396 {
00397     //get parameters
00398     int N = apriori_data.cols();//emitted frames of non-zero samples
00399     int K = apriori_data.rows();//number of users
00400     int L = impulse_response.cols()-1;//channel order
00401     //other parameters
00402     register int n,k;
00403 
00404     //mean and variance of each chip (NxK)
00405     itpp::mat Ex = -itpp::tanh(apriori_data/2.0);//take into account BPSK mapping
00406     itpp::mat Vx = 1.0-itpp::sqr(Ex);
00407 
00408     //mean and variance for the samples of the received signal
00409     itpp::vec Er(N+L);
00410     Er.zeros();
00411     itpp::vec Vr = sigma2*itpp::ones(N+L);
00412     itpp::vec buffer(N+L);
00413     for (k=0;k<K;k++)
00414     {
00415         zpFIRfilter(buffer, impulse_response.get_row(k), Ex.get_row(k));
00416         Er += buffer;
00417         zpFIRfilter(buffer, itpp::sqr(impulse_response.get_row(k)), Vx.get_row(k));
00418         Vr += buffer;
00419     }
00420 
00421     //extrinsic information for the samples of the received signal
00422     Er = rec_sig-Er;
00423     itpp::vec ch(L+1);
00424     extrinsic_data.set_size(K,N);
00425     for (k=0;k<K;k++)
00426     {
00427         ch = impulse_response.get_row(k);
00428 #pragma omp parallel for private(n)
00429         for (n=0;n<N;n++)
00430         {
00431             extrinsic_data(k,n) = -2*itpp::elem_div(ch, Vr.mid(n,L+1)-sqr(ch)*Vx(k,n))*(Er.mid(n,L+1)+ch*Ex(k,n));//take into account BPSK mapping
00432         }
00433     }
00434 }
00435 }//end namespace tr
